list_definition.definition: (often with with) to think or say the same (as)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I agreed with them that we should try again
The newspaper report does not agree with what he told us.

list_definition.definition: to say that one will do or allow something
(with with) to be good for (usually one’s health)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Cheese does not agree with me – it gives me indigestion.

list_definition.definition: to be happy and friendly together

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: John and his wife don’t agree.
The totals in the two columns do not agree.

list_ex_of_english: Figures 6 and 7 show in detail the evolution of the shelf after its initial formation and the perturbation and numerical results agree almost precisely.
To protect informants and actors engaged in youth politics, they are not identified unless otherwise agreed.
Her husband remained unco-operative and it seemed unlikely that either would agree to any help, unless she did have a difficult pregnancy or labour.
The remaining parties agreed to pay their own costs.

At a particular "real" moment, will doctor, nurse, patient, and family agree to what had been planned when the topic was "theoretical"?

We agree with barlow on the plausibility of rotation-tuned visual cortical neurons, which may be involved in the twisting motion experience in shepard's experiments.
